storyInfo:
Zima approaches Natalya, her companion in the Ursus Student Self-Governing Group. Both of them have questions to ask, as well as things they want to confide.
The problem has not been solved, but they will face the future together.

attributes.content: This unripe texture, this slightly-too-salty flavor, oh, I'm finally home again!
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: It was just a long mission. You don't have to kiss the deck.
attributes.name: Logistics Operator

attributes.content: Hey, you don't know how I take to Ursus food. It really doesn't agree with me.
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: Our canteen's way better. I like everything here.
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: The way you just put it, it doesn't exactly sound like you like it.
attributes.name: Logistics Operator

attributes.content: Something doesn't have to taste good for me to like it.
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: I helped some survivors find their relatives and they thanked me with a banquet. A big, classy, noble shindig.
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: But let's just say my palate isn't so refined.
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: Yeah, sure. You're totally dependent on the Rhodes Island Cafeteria.
attributes.name: Logistics Operator

attributes.content: So what was the mission?
attributes.name: Logistics Operator

attributes.content: I'm pretty sure you know the deal. Resettling the refugees from Chernobog in other Ursus cities. Easy stuff, but time-consuming.
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: Forget I asked. I know how much refugee ops mean to you.
attributes.name: Logistics Operator

attributes.content: Yeah. There's only so much we can do when there's so many of them and so few of us. But a life saved is a life saved.
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: I heard Dobermann talking about how we're not in the best position with Ursus right now, so it's great that Amiya and the Doctor are still willing to do these rescue operations.
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: Sure. We lucked out with those two.
attributes.name: Logistics Operator

attributes.content: Well, there's another one we owe a lot of thanks too.
attributes.name: Logistics Operator

attributes.content: Oh yeah, I heard about her out on the road. Some girl named Natalya?
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: Right. She's a big celebrity here now.
attributes.name: Logistics Operator

attributes.content: Oooh, my ears are burning.
Hey, Natalya, how you doing?
attributes.name: Logistics Operator

attributes.content: Good afternoon, Mr. Saren. And you are...?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Codename Compass. Nice to meet you.
attributes.name: Vanguard Operator

attributes.content: Compass.. a fine codename. Good afternoon. Would you mind if I joined you?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: By all means!
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: Hey, didn't I hear she was just a student?
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: This is no little girl! She's *gulp* pretty big!
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: What do you think 'student' means?
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: I don't know how to talk to a lady like this!
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: Relax. Natalya's real easy-going.
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: Did I happen to overhear that the good Compass has just returned from resettling refugees?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: That's right. We were just talking about it.
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: I was telling him all that you did to help.
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: Oh my role was completely trivial.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: You're too modest. If it wasn't for Natalya pushing the survivors along, we would've had a much tougher time.
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: The refugees were talking about her too. They said there was a kind young lady who told them Rhodes Island is good people.
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: And after hearing it right from Saren, I really gotta thank you, Miss Natalya.
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: The refugees having a good image of us makes all the difference in the world. Without you, I know things would've gone bad out there.
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: I mean, I was a refugee too. I know how they think. But it still sucks when you're trying to do good and people don't trust you.
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: I did the absolute bare minimum. It was you out there doing the real work, Compass.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: And it's not that they don't trust Rhodes Island. It's that they've suffered a Catastrophe and they don't trust anyone.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I sensed that Rhodes Island had everyone's best interests at heart. And having been Student Council President, I was used to this business. It's what I'm good at.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: You hear that, Saren? This is how you talk to people. Listen up.
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: Didn't I just say Natalya is easy-going?
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: When word got around that the new kid was some aristocratic heiress, we were all worried about getting along.
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: But it turns out she's good at her job, easy to talk to, super easy to get along with. We all love Natalya.
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: Oh my no. Everyone's only willing to put up with me because I'm so young.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Speaking of, did you decide to stay with Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: I did. I passed the Logistics Department's examination last week. I am now formally employed by Rhodes Island Pharmaceuticals.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Wow, that's great news. You're gonna love it here, trust me.
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: I'm already very pleased.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: As long as we're on the subject, Mr. Saren, I've finished compiling the second refugee manifest, pairing names with destinations. If you wouldn't mind sending it along after lunch.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: What? Already?
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: That means the refugees we saved all have somewhere to go?
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: Yes. Aside from those who are still undergoing treatment.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Incredible. It's a good thing the section chief put you on the task.
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: I'm only doing my duty.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I guess I'd better go put in for the second resettlement op then.
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: You want to head out there again? Didn't you just get done telling me you can't stand Ursus food?
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: Yeah, but seeing the survivors return to their homes and their relatives, seeing them so happy makes up for it.
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: Right, I'm about done with lunch. Help me with the tray, will you? I gotta go apply.
attributes.name: Compass

attributes.content: Hey, bus your own tray!
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: Sorry about him, Natalya. That's just how he is.
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: Our good Compass has quite the attachment to the refugees...?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: He does. You heard him say he was a refugee too, right? One of our teams saved him, so he's pretty gung ho about any ops that have to do with refugees.
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: And you seem to get along well?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Oh, yeah. I guess we do. He was in Logistics for a bit, before transferring to the front lines. We had some time together, our personalities clicked, and so we're friends.
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: You're with that Ursus Student Self-Governing Group, right?
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: Yes. But Son... Zima and the girls are front line operators like Compass, and I'm in Logistics.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I heard you were all found together. You're very close too?
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: ...Yes, yes we are. We were together all that time. We're very close.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: You went through it as a group. That's good. Err, not to say that kind of hardship is good.
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: I know what you mean.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Oh? Zima...
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Speak of the devil, huh?
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: Is she staring at you?
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Forgive me, Saren. I must be going.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Yeah, sure.
attributes.name: Operator Saren

attributes.content: Are you looking for me, Zima?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Are you okay? You look pale.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I'm fine. I shouldn't have come looking for you. Forget I was here.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Hey, wait.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Don't touch me!
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Talk to me, Sonya. We haven't had a good talk since we came here.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Come to my room.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Have a seat. Care for a drink? Coffee? Tea? I have both.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: ...That's the aristocrat in you.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: You still have the strength to tease me. Looks like you're in better shape than I thought. Your face back there was a ghastly sight.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Let's call it coffee then. Rhodes Island has some fine beans, but I can't say the same for their tea.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I've heard it has to do with the Chief Engineer. She's quite particular about her coffee. What do you think?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: How should I know?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Heh heh. I've been hearing nothing but praise lately. I'd missed your venomous tongue.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: And I'm sick of you already.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Do you take it with sugar?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Really? It's black.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Enjoy.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Bleh.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: It's too bitter, isn't it?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Come now. Take a spoonful of sugar.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Did you drag me here to screw with me?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: You're the one who wouldn't take the sugar, Sonya.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: And let's not forget, it was you who came looking for me.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I already told you, that was a mistake. We're not friends. I don't like you.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: True. We're not friends. Nor is Anna my friend. We simply survived together.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Simply...
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Sonya, there are some things that are harder to say to those closest to you.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: If you were my friend, I would not have brought you here.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Some things can only be said to someone unimportant, someone who understands your situation.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: For me, the best person is Anna. But you'll do.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Mmm... Rosalind is too direct and open. While Lada is too honest and kindhearted. They won't do.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Surely you feel the same. Which means you have only me, I'm afraid. I'm honestly not surprised you came to me.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Does that mean you want to talk to me?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: ...Sonya, these last two months, how do you feel, fighting as an operator?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: What do you mean 'feel?' It's just fighting. I guess it does suck to have to listen to that Doctor.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Your talking back to the Doctor even made it up to Logistics. You're quite something.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: ...I'm not like you. I don't talk fancy.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: What I really want to ask is, after all we've been through, do you not struggle to pick up a weapon?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: ...I like fighting.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I see... Still, I think it would be in your best interest to learn some 'fancy talk.' It could save your life.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: You don't have to worry.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: We may not be friends, but we've been through so much together. I think it's normal to care about you, as a colleague.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: And to tell the truth, I do quite like you. I would like to be your friend.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: To be more precise, I'd say I envy you. Because you do so easily what I could never do.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Now then, Sonya, won't you tell me what made you seek me out?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: ...I've been having nightmares lately.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Can you describe them to me?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Alright. Let me guess. They must be something you can't talk to Anna about. Otherwise you wouldn't have come to me, right?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: ...Right.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I figured it out while we were still in Chernobog.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: You two have an understanding. You each know what the other needs, but you avoid talking about it.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: None of your business.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Relax, I'm not trying to tell you what to do. I'm in no position to be giving advice to others right now.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Let's talk about something else, Sonya. Do you plan to live your life as Zima now?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I mean are you going to stay at Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: We don't have to. The people here are very understanding. If we wanted to leave, they would send us off somewhere peaceful.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: There are many survivors like us, rescued at the same time, already on their way back to Ursus.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: If we wanted to, we could go to another city in the Empire and start new lives.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: So why haven't you left?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I don't know.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Nice weather today. Isn't it, Sonya?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Perfect for a picnics.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Hey.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Back when we were combing through the ruins, desperate for food, stretching a single bottle of water to last an entire day, I often thought to myself:
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: 'If I survive this, I'm going to find a lovely garden on a sunny afternoon and have a sumptuous picnic.'
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Hey!
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: But far more often I thought——
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: 'I wish you killed me that day.'
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Don't hesitate. Don't pity me. Don't think to save me. Look down at this wretched aristocrat girl, and swing your axe.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: It may have been the very best thing for me, had you just ended my life right there.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: There's still time.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: You really could?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: We left that place, Sonya. We've returned to the civilized world.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: We must think as civilized people. We must use civilized methods to solve our problems. Those things that happened back there cannot happen again.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Who cares.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: You care. You're a good person, Sonya. 'General Zima,' Protector of the Weak, Bane of the Bullies.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Don't make me puke.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: That's the Sonya I heard rumors about.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I just can't stand those punks who get a little bit of strength and think it's a license to bully.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: You must hate the aristocracy then?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Duh. A bunch of a fake-ass self-important shitheads.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Yes. They, or rather, we are 'fake-ass self-important shitheads.'
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Since you brought me back, I don't think I've ever told you what happened to me before you showed up, did I?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Nope. I just know you were in charge of that gang of nobles.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I'll tell you the story sometime.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Whatever.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Most of the nobility and wealthy people fled the city when Reunion came, or even before.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: They know they were coming?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Yes. They did.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: ...sons of bitches.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Indeed. But you know, nobles are selfish.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: You too?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: So why did you stay?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: My family was just too slow. We were trapped with some other noble families. Some houses didn't take the threat seriously, of course.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Oh.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Come now, don't give me that face. This background is important to frame the story. We'll get to the good part.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: In short, the students who were sent to your school fell into either the 'slow' or 'stupid' categories.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: We were at first meant to stay with our parents, for Reunion to use as hostages to bargain with the Empire. But in the end, we were separated and sent to the school.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: That's kinda weird.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: It was. Nobles make good hostages in a time of war. Not to be wasted.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: The aristocracy is elegant, noble, and should command respect. Even as a captive, one must never forget her house.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: You're all screwed in the head.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: The old me would have locked you in a two hour debate for saying that, Sonya. Because that's how I was raised.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: But now, I agree.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: There is no real difference between nobles and commoners. It's all window dressing. Scrape off the veneer and the aristocracy is truly ugly.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: We talked about how if it weren't for the first fire, if we didn't lose that food store, things wouldn't have gotten so bad.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: But Anna said even without the fire, something else would have happened.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: If I had been through that, I would have thought the same.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: But in any case, it's post-hoc—— 'What needed to happen to cause all that came after.'
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: The funny thing is, nobles don't need anything to happen. Put them together and they fight.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Should I get into the differences between new and old nobility? The mayor's political leanings? How many factions there are in the Chernobog aristocracy?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Could you, like, not do that?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: But then you won't understand why they fight.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I guess I'll just never understand.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I'm not really interested in these things either. But as a daughter of the House of Rostov, I had to learn.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: All you need to know is that from the very first day we were locked up in the school, the noble students were backstabbing each other.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I had no choice but to step forward as the Student Council President of #4 Secondary School and use my status to bring order.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: You mean you organized them to put an end to the infighting?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Sounds reasonable, doesn't it? In order to stop my classmates from fighting, I stood up and took charge.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Uh, ah...
attributes.name: Viktor

attributes.content: Don't think you rule the roost just because your father owns a mine, Pavel!
attributes.name: Nikola

attributes.content: A mere baron dares to take such a tone with me. He's lucky he doesn't find my blade in his chest.
attributes.name: Pavel

attributes.content: As for you, second son of the House of Ivanov, when did it become your turn to speak? Maybe you'd like a new hole in your torso as well?
attributes.name: Pavel

attributes.content: How dare you...?! My father is a councilor!
attributes.name: Nikola

attributes.content: A councilor? Do you know how many councilors come to my mother's soirees every Sunday?
attributes.name: Pavel

attributes.content: Oh, you don't? Because your father doesn't make the cut.
attributes.name: Pavel

attributes.content: You!
attributes.name: Nikola

attributes.content: Hold your tongue, Pavel!
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Please, Natalya, call me Pasha. You need not be so formal.
attributes.name: Pavel

attributes.content: I'm serious, Pavel Nikolaevich! You are not to start another senseless quarrel!
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: As you wish, my esteemed President of the Student Council.
attributes.name: Pavel

attributes.content: Tatyana, please bandage Viktor's wound.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: O- of course!
attributes.name: Tatyana

attributes.content: Ladies and gentlemen, we have been sealed inside this school. We know not what will happen. But I suspect that Reunion Movement won't let us go lightly.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Look at what you've become. It hasn't been twelve hours and you're arguing, fighting, even threatening to kill your fellow nobles.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Is this how the aristocracy behaves?!
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Who the hell are you? Why should I listen to you?!
attributes.name: Anton

attributes.content: Because she is the president of the student council at #4 Secondary School, Natalya Andreyevna Rostova!
attributes.name: Tatyana

attributes.content: Y- you're the eldest daughter of Count Rostov?!
attributes.name: Anton

attributes.content: She is the 'Pearl of #4,' the one whom Count Rostov has declared his heir.
attributes.name: Andrey

attributes.content: We have gathered here the nobility from each district secondary school. I do not wish to focus on my rank. I simply must impress upon you all the gravity of our situation.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: We find ourselves surrounded by many common students, and I do not want them to see such disgraceful conduct from us.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Furthermore, while we have been trapped here by the Reunion Movement, they will not seek to harm us, if they wish to secure concessions from the Empire.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Are we going to waste our precious lives on such infighting?!
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: We need unity, now more than ever!
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Of course, we now know Reunion didn't give a damn about us aristocrats.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Anyway, I was able to put a stop to their fighting. But in a situation like that, pretty words and a fancy title will only get you so far.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Sonya, do you know why the Empire of Ursus is as strong as it is?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: In fact, there were quite a few noble students who were unwilling to submit to my authority, or share the same room with someone else, and left the group.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: In the end, I had some three dozen under me.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: At the time, I thought I had done very well.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: So that's why there were still so many noble shitstains lurking around.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Yes, I'm sure they made their own groups as well.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: How was I supposed to know?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: It's a shame. I'm enjoying this conversation with you, but I do wish Anna was here for it.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Don't change the subject.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Oh, I'm sorry. I do have more to say, but it's hard to get the words out.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Ursus is what it is today because of war. The previous monarch waged endless war, pillaging resources, and investing them in the next campaign.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: As long as there was war, the Empire could function, the people united in their common struggle.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I... I agree with President Rostova.
attributes.name: Nikola

attributes.content: I will submit to the President's leadership.
attributes.name: Pavel

attributes.content: If you are all willing to put your trust in me, I am willing to serve the group.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: (I was able to stop the fight, barely, but what do I do next...?)
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: That being the case, I have a proposal.
attributes.name: Pavel

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: You were correct when you said we have a responsibility to preserve the dignity of the aristocracy.
attributes.name: Pavel

attributes.content: Therefore, it's time the commoners offered us a contribution, to ensure we can live in such dignity.
attributes.name: Pavel

attributes.content: You mean...?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Yes, I agreed to let them prey on the commoners.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Sonya, I used to think myself a good person.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: At least, at the time, that's how I thought.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I would find the social machinations of the aristocracy boring and hypocritical, I would bemoan the tragedies of the world, I would even serve meals to refugees.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: But I will not lie to you, or to myself.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: At that time, to unite the nobles, I allowed them to pillage.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: 'Wham!' The white-haired girl is thrown to the floor. She takes a few solid hits to the face. And as the slight trickle of crimson blood slips from her mouth, it curls into a smile.
A tragic smile.
*Cough,* *cough...*
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: You piece of...
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I am a monster.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: But you know, Sonya, I wouldn't realize it if I never spent that time with you, if I never came to Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Without these experiences, I would not think as I do now.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: You taught me that I am not noble, in the true sense of the word. And that is the most painful knowledge I must endure.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: That is why I say it would have been better had you killed me like you did my companions.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I could have died peacefully, indulging in the fantasy that I was a good girl, that I was forced by circumstance to do what I did.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: ...Do you know, Sonya, what this is?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: A letter opener.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: These past few months, I have twenty-six times thought to slit my wrists. Fifteen times I thought to slash open my throat.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: ...You can count 'em, huh?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Because each time I fail, I laugh at myself for being such a stupid coward. That stays with me.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Of course, I've considered more aristocratic methods as well: poisoned tea, a saber. I've even thought carefully about what calligraphic style to use in my suicide note.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Unfortunately, all of those methods would be discovered before I could pull off the deed. And I don't want to make trouble.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: What's your point?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I told Rhodes Island: I want to stay here and do what I can for the people of Ursus.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I told myself: Natalya, this is your atonement.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: But is that true?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Whenever I think of Nikola's smile, of any of their faces as they came to me, triumphant after robbing the commoners; of my cowardice as I smiled back at them, rather than reprimanding their evil.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Whenever I think of all that I let them do, of the plans I would make for them, of the joy I took in our comfortable hoard of supplies.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Whenever I think of all the screaming and crying I ignored, of how I thought myself innocent by way of circumstance, of how I began to grow accustomed to living that way.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Sonya, can you believe it? That in that entire battle royale, I did not kill a single person?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: And yet, I bear the most guilt.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Did you think I brought you here to tell you what you should do?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: No, Sonya. I don't know. I have no idea. About anything.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I don't even know how to tell people I don't know! All I can do is put on that stupid facade that I have everything perfectly under control as I drag you in here!
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Do you...?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Phew, I'm sorry. I lost my composure.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: ...Do you want something to drink?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Black tea, please. Thank you.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Okay.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: So uh, where do you keep the black tea?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: You've got a shitload of different tea boxes over here. I can't tell what's what.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Oof.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Hup.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I'll get it, Sonya.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Uh, sorry.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: It just occurred to me you probably don't know how to make tea. Forgive the momentary lapse in judgment that pushed you to do something you're not good at.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Why you...
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Say, Sonya, what exactly were you thinking back then?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: After the fire, I ran as fast as I could only to be caught by some other students. Why did you save me?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: You knew of course that I was the leader of the nobles wreaking havoc just days before.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I forget.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: You probably just looked too pathetic.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Then why would you let me join the Self-Governing Group?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Because Anna said it was okay.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Do you want me to hate you, Natalya?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I don't know. Can you hate me?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I've never seen a shithead admit she's a shithead before.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: So a shithead who admits she's a shithead isn't a shithead anymore?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: ...Do you want me to crush you?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I'm no masochist. It's just, how should I say? I'd like to be honest with you, um, after all that you just heard, to avoid any misunderstandings.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Maso... what?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Oh, that's just a kind of 'hobby' popular in aristocratic circles. I've only heard rumors, actually. Don't worry about it.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: As long as I don't have to kick your ass again.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: You don't want to?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Do you prefer Columbian or Victorian? Tea, that is.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: ...You're right back to your old self.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Whatever, I can't drink it anyway.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: It's how I was raised. I must show my most refined side at all times.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Sugar?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: ...Yeah.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Sorry, you can't sweeten this kind of tea. Drink it straight, please.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: You suck.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Look, Natalya, I don't know how I'm supposed to cheer you up. And anyway I really don't wanna.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Oh? Not only do you not hate me, you want to comfort me?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Shut your tea hole.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Alright, alright.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I hate trying to comfort people. Every time I try, I screw everything up.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: All I can do is tell you what I'm thinking.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: You asked me a minute ago if I was gonna keep on living as Zima.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: The answer is yes.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: My mom and dad died in Chernobog. There's nothing for me to go back to. I don't wanna go back to Ursus. So that's that.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I think I should be able to understand your pain or whatever, but I really don't.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: At first, I thought you wanted to justify yourself. Punks talk like that when they want to sucker-punch me while I'm distracted. But you seem legit sad. Why?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Those noble shitstains wouldn't have been any better off without you. And you're not the one who turned them into dickheads anyway. You didn't make all that happen.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: It was actually me...
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: You?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Nothing, forget it. But if I was one of those nobles, I might've liked having a leader like you. Same way Istina chose me.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: You did what you could.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I only hate you because you were my enemy before you weren't. Also I hate nobles. That's all.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Oh, and I have nightmares, and the nightmares make me puke, and then I can't sleep because I'm sad.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: But doing what you can to survive isn't bad.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: And I don't think it was bad to let you live.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: You think you're a shithead. But I know, without you, just relying on Anna, we never would've survived those next couple weeks.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Just go for a run. Eat when you're hungry. Sleep when you're tired. Better than sitting around moping.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Hup.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Ahahahahaha.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: What's making you laugh like that? Jeez, you're tearing up.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Nothing. It's just, this is why it's nice to chat with you.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: If it were Anna and me, we'd be bawling our eyes out over each other by now.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: She doesn't like you either, don't forget.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I know. Pfft. Hahaha! I know.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Listen, Sonya.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: What are you doing?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: I want you to know, you completely failed to address my problem.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: I'm way too lazy to care.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: And I think there's nothing I could do to help with yours.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: But you were right on one point: we survived.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Do you think we'll get over it, in the end?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: The circle beneath our feet, the night, the maze, our minds, our thoughts, the abyss.
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Could you use like, real words?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Right, right. Anyway, operators all have codenames, right? If I were to become an operator, what should my codename be?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: How should I know? Anna picked mine.
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Okay. What do you think of Rosa?
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: Ursine for 'dew?'
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: Yes, like morning dew. Can you call me 'Rosa?'
attributes.name: Natalya

attributes.content: O...kay?
attributes.name: Zima

attributes.content: It's settled. If I'm to become an operator, they'll call me Rosa.
attributes.name: Rosa
